summary:
The Security Council,
 Reaffirming resolutions 696 (1991), 864 (1993) and 1127 (1997), 
 Recalling its President's statement of 28 March 2002, 
 Welcoming the Government of Angola and UNITA's signing of the Memorandum of Understanding Addendum to the Lusaka Protocol, 
 Welcoming efforts to restore peace and promote national reconciliation, 
 Reaffirming commitment to Angola's sovereignty and territorial integrity, 
 Emphasizing implementation of the “Acordos de Paz”, Lusaka Protocol, and relevant resolutions, 
 Reaffirming UNITA's need to cooperate with demobilization and reintegration, 
 Recognizing the need to facilitate travel by UNITA members, 
 Acting under Chapter VII, 
1. Suspends measures imposed by paragraphs 4 (a) and (b) of resolution 1127 (1997) for 90 days; 
2. Decides to review suspension before the end of this period, considering progress in Angola's national reconciliation; 
3. Remains seized of the matter.
